channel.title: Custom User-Interface
channel.description: I'm new to this client hacking thing, I've only worked with private server clients before. I was wondering if it's possible to edit the user interface? I have the client, but no image files. If it's possible could somebody tell me how?

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Only do this if you are fucking around with the rsc client.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @abeckring abeckring
item.description:
@abeckring wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:14, topic:392584”]Wouldn’t this be just like a private server client, except instead of .dat/.idx#, you have to deal with a .dll? If so, all you would have to do is unpack the cache, switch out the image files you want and repack it, just like you would do with a private server client using Tom’s cache suite. I haven’t seen any applications written for this specific purpose though, so that would be your biggest problem.

[quote author=Ollie link=topic=489756.msg3582093#msg3582093 date=1303872429]
its possible to do and not be banned, and there are many reasons for doing it.

for example, change tabs to static colours so each tab has an individual colour, change all trees types you want to chop to be green and have an auto-woodcutter find the colour green and perform “Chop” on it.[/quote]

This made me drool, it would make color macros so much easier to write.[/quote]

That might be just the information I need, I’ll look into unpacking. If this isn’t the right way then can somebody correct me.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

It’s definitely not an efficient way to bot though when grabbing field data is as easy as it is, and we have a pretty decent number of identified fields we can play with.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Wouldn’t this be just like a private server client, except instead of .dat/.idx#, you have to deal with a .dll? If so, all you would have to do is unpack the cache, switch out the image files you want and repack it, just like you would do with a private server client using Tom’s cache suite. I haven’t seen any applications written for this specific purpose though, so that would be your biggest problem.

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:392584”]its possible to do and not be banned, and there are many reasons for doing it.

for example, change tabs to static colours so each tab has an individual colour, change all trees types you want to chop to be green and have an auto-woodcutter find the colour green and perform “Chop” on it.[/quote]

This made me drool, it would make color macros so much easier to write.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:392584”]its possible to do and not be banned, and there are many reasons for doing it.

for example, change tabs to static colours so each tab has an individual colour, change all trees types you want to chop to be green and have an auto-woodcutter find the colour green and perform “Chop” on it.

Chances are, you would try to change the interface data via the cache. Then when the client starts, it performs a CRC check on the cache, compares it against the server, sees a mismatch, downloads the correct data from the server.

you do realise, like anything you can fake the check confirmation?[/quote]

Yes, but by the time s/he found a pattern for finding where the CRC check happens, and returning the faked sum, it would probably take more.

I may be mistaken, but the process would have to be something like

  1. On client start up, create a checksum
  2. Change the method to return the faked checksum

But as I understand, even then there would be different side effects due to the “content streaming” during game play.

Although it’s been a while since I looked very deep into anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

its possible to do and not be banned, and there are many reasons for doing it.

for example, change tabs to static colours so each tab has an individual colour, change all trees types you want to chop to be green and have an auto-woodcutter find the colour green and perform “Chop” on it.

zyle1992:

Chances are, you would try to change the interface data via the cache. Then when the client starts, it performs a CRC check on the cache, compares it against the server, sees a mismatch, downloads the correct data from the server.

you do realise, like anything you can fake the check confirmation?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

abeckring:

I’ve edited some other stuff and haven’t been banned, I’ll take my chances. I just need to know how it could be done.

Want to know how you can do it?

You can’t.

Chances are, you would try to change the interface data via the cache. Then when the client starts, it performs a CRC check on the cache, compares it against the server, sees a mismatch, downloads the correct data from the server.

If you tried to hard code it into the client, by the time you found out what is what, the client will have updated, and you would need to do it again.

/thread

Read full topic

item.title: Custom User-Interface
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

abeckring:

I’m new to this client hacking thing, I’ve only worked with private server clients before. I was wondering if it’s possible to edit the user interface? I have the client, but no image files. If it’s possible could somebody tell me how?

It would be much easier to just add the features and whatever you want to the external GUI, instead of the in game GUI.

Read full topic
